review: Spielberg loves the smell of sentiment in the morning. But sentiment at the expense of narrative honesty? Nobody should love that.
agree: I completely agree with Lucius Shepard's review of 'The Color Purple'. The film's excessive sentimentality and lack of narrative honesty detract from the overall impact of the story. The jarring mix of dark themes with whimsical cinematography and misplaced comedy creates a disjointed viewing experience that fails to do justice to the source material.
disagree: I respectfully disagree with Lucius Shepard's review of 'The Color Purple'. While the film may have its flaws in terms of tone and execution, it still manages to convey important themes of female empowerment and resilience in the face of adversity. The performances, particularly by the lead actresses, bring depth and emotion to the characters, making the film a poignant exploration of the human spirit.

review: Spielberg didn't deserve to win any Oscar for this piece, and the Academy was right in that vote. The way Spielberg directs this is so contrived, so meddlesome. This is over-the-top sentimentality with examples of faux behavior throughout the film.
agree: I completely agree with this review. The sentimentality in the movie felt forced and unrealistic. The contrived scenes and exaggerated emotions took away from the authenticity of the story. Spielberg's direction did not deserve an Oscar for this film.
disagree: I respectfully disagree with the review. While I understand the criticism of the sentimentality in the movie, I believe Spielberg's direction still showcased his talent. The emotional depth and character development in the film, despite some contrived moments, were still impactful. Spielberg's ability to evoke strong emotions from the audience should not be discounted.

review: This is really terrible. The only redeeming feature about this movie is that the next time people ask me what is the worst vampire movie I have ever watched, I would have a suitable reply. I think it is filmed on 35 mm so it is already tacky like hell. I wouldn't have bothered commenting but I noticed some fanboys (probably connected to the movie) had claimed that this was the best movie since the Matrix. Let me debunk the myths and lies. There is nothing good in the movie. Everything yells tacky. The actress is ugly. The fight choreography is the worst I have ever seen. The fight scenes are unbelievably amateurish. Imagine a girl flailing her arms around in a circle helplessly and delivering weak kicks which wouldn't hurt a kitten. Obviously, the director just pulled people off the street to give them roles in the movie. I know the director did not have much budget for the movie but still better movies have been made on smaller budget before. Unforgivable.
agree: I completely agree with this review. The movie sounds like a disaster from start to finish, with tacky filming, amateurish fight choreography, and unconvincing performances. It's disappointing to hear that some have hyped it up as the best movie since The Matrix, as it clearly falls short in every aspect.
disagree: I respectfully disagree with this review. While the movie may have its flaws, such as low budget constraints and subpar fight scenes, it's important to acknowledge the effort that goes into making a film. Criticizing the appearance of the actress and the director's casting choices seems unnecessarily harsh and disrespectful. Every movie has its audience, and some may appreciate the film for its unique qualities despite its shortcomings.

review: Dude, really!!!! where have you guys been the past 20 years, this is shocking in all kind of ways, horror ? This is a joke, there is nothing wrong with being low budget, but this is a laugh, If you want to look at the classics, Freaks of Tod Browning, the victims of Dracula and Frankenstein, the Undying Monster, Ernest Thesiger, Paul Wegener's The Golem and the passengers of The Ghost Train, you can't compare it, it gives it a bad name, bad acting, bad screenplay etc. Total waist of money and free time, have watched a lot of movies, were as horror is my all time favorite, I really am speechless, have nothing more to say that please don't do the effort to watch something so daft, please understand
agree: I completely agree with this review. The comparison to classic horror films highlights the shortcomings of this movie in terms of acting, screenplay, and overall quality. It's disappointing to see a film that falls so short in the horror genre.
disagree: I respectfully disagree with this review. While the reviewer may have valid points about the quality of the movie compared to classics, everyone's taste in horror is subjective. Some viewers may appreciate the low-budget charm and find enjoyment in different aspects of the film despite its flaws.

review: This movie is easily the worst I've seen in a long time, with bad acting, cliché visuals, and poor special effects. It falls short of being a redeemable film and lacks any genuine entertainment value.
agree: I completely agree with this review. The movie's attempt at not taking itself too seriously comes across as a failed cover-up for its overall poor quality. The lack of authenticity in the special effects and the subpar acting make it a painful viewing experience.
disagree: I respectfully disagree with this review. While the movie may not have met the standards of classic vampire films, it could still be appreciated for its attempt at a different take on the genre. The self-awareness and potential for humor in the film could be seen as a refreshing change from the typical serious vampire narratives.

review: Valentine is another horror movie to add to the stalk and slash movie list. It certainly isn't as good as some of the classics like Halloween or Scream, but it's better than most of the ripoffs that came out after the first Friday the 13th film.
agree: I agree with the review that Valentine falls somewhere in between the classic horror films and the lesser ripoffs. The attractive cast does their best with the material, but the lackluster script holds the movie back from being truly great.
disagree: I disagree with the review's assessment that Valentine is better than My Bloody Valentine. While the film may have some scary moments and an attractive cast, the overall execution and plot seem to fall short of creating a truly memorable horror experience.

review: There's one line that makes it worth to rent for Angel fans. Everyone else: this is just a very bad horror flick. The female characters are typical horror movies females. They are wooden, annoying and dumb. You are glad when they are killed off. Long live the strong female character in a horror movie!!
agree: I agree with the review. The female characters in this movie were indeed poorly written and lacked depth. It's disappointing to see such stereotypical portrayals in a modern horror film.
disagree: I disagree with the review. While the female characters may not have been the strongest, the movie still had some redeeming qualities that make it worth watching, especially for fans of Angel. The horror genre often relies on certain tropes, and this film may have been playing into that intentionally.
